meanings.definition: The amount of passengers or cargo that a plane can carry.
meanings.sent1: The planeload of passengers boarded the plane for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: The airport staff quickly unloaded the planeload of cargo from the aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The planeload of passengers all wore matching hats, creating a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The planeload of cargo seemed to weigh as much as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The planeload of passengers cheered as the plane took off into the sky.

meanings.definition: The act of filling a plane with passengers or cargo.
meanings.sent1: The efficient crew managed to complete the planeload in record time.
meanings.sent2: The airline company announced a delay due to the late arrival of the planeload.
meanings.sent3: The planeload of passengers formed a conga line while waiting to board.
meanings.sent4: The planeload of cargo was carefully stacked to ensure a safe flight.
meanings.sent5: The planeload of passengers waved goodbye to their loved ones from the window.
